description:
Legit hangout spot for basic cocktails and a brew. Old heads abound with a dark and sleepy vibe.

Just one long bar and the characters you find at it, essentially.

I had the pleasure of meeting the head bartender and he was definitely an interesting gent. 

All in all the bar is great you can tell it's been around for awhile. 

If you aren't trying to cheese up the vibe and want some peace and quiet from the annoying buzz of the Mission, I highly recommend you come here.

If you are young and you live in the mission though, your presence is probably cheesy and as such you should stay far far away.
author: John W.

description:
Usually love this spot, usually the bartenders are cool. The lady on tuesday mornings, quite rude. Asked for our IDs without a greeting and then left me with it in my hand while she finished her convo with another patron. 
To top it all off she couldn't even remember my drink order correctly. Should I say cared enough to remember? 
I know I may look young but I bartend too and am sick of getting attitude from older bartenders because they have a complex. 

Could have scored $5 tip on two drinks but instead left her $2 ($1 per drink, minus $3 for attitude) 

Won't be back to spend my hard earned money here for a while.
author: Chelsea L.

description: Oakyish bar, but they only accept cash and the atm didn't give me my 20 and felt like it stole my bank information.
author: Andrew Q.

description: Bouncers at the front door actually tried to steal my friends ID. They let him through but then the bouncer put the ID in his pocket. My friend, completely sober, was bewildering asking for his ID back. The second I suggested the best action was for everyone to empty pockets, the bouncers suspiciously flipped out and started accusing us of racism and telling us to leave. After pointing at the exact pocket the ID was in and telling him to empty it, we eventually got the bouncer to cave and give the ID back. The organized effort to keep the ID was bizarre, if you come here be careful.
author: Mitchell M.

description:
CASH ONLY

An okay spot to pass the night in the Mission. They have a long bar area and some small tables good for 2-4 people in the back. They do play music but it's not so loud that you can't hear yourself when trying to have a conversation.

So why my 3 star review? There are no servers working and only had one bartender working the bar even on a Friday night, so that means 1) you have to get your drink at the bar, which is fine, but also 2) the service is incredibly *incredibly* slow... 

We grabbed a table when we first arrived and two of us stayed there to hold it while one friend went off to the bar area with our drink requests. Since there was only one bartender working, it was really hard for my friend to get her attention, only to be told that he needed to show the IDs for everyone drinking. He went back with our IDs and *cue another round of waiting* had to wait a while before she was free to take his order.

I think the bartender must have felt bad about making my friend wait so long, since she ended up charging him only 20 bucks for our 3 drinks. I went with my go-to which was an amaretto sour, and those usually set me back at least 10 bucks at a bar, so there was definitely a heavy discount in there somewhere. 

We ended up chilling here for a good 1.5-2 hours though, so it was a pretty chill way to pass a Friday night in the Mission. There's also a shuffleboard table in the back so different groups of people were taking turns playing on it which was fun to watch. Plus it's close to a lot of taquerias so you can easily grab some drunchies afterwards :D
author: Dianna H.

description: A very chill dive bar. Came here for farewell party. Love that they have shuffle board. Prices are decent. There's no food here but there's a good selection of drinks
author: Chelsea H.

description:
Other people have said it, the staff thinks its cool to be rude

There are PLENTY of other places to get a drink...
author: Willy M.

description: Went there last night and the bouncer tried to steal my friends ID. He clearly saw him put it in his pocket but the bouncer kept on insisting he gave it back. There was another manager (think he was a manager) that got abruptly defensive/aggressive when we asked the bouncer he could check his pockets. He eventually fessed up to taking it and gave it back to us. I don't know how he thought my friend wouldn't notice; this guy literally put in his pocket in front of my friends face haha. The whole situation really sucked to say the least. Hope this doesn't happen to anyone else.
author: Israel C.

description:
No pros and cons here... just pre's and post's....Sometimes you need to go deep into the brain to remember a place! Post drag queen bingo, post dinner, pre sleep, I entered Doc's Clock with some work buds. 
The dark, slightly dingy, slightly packed full dive bar was just what the Doctor ordered post midnight for cheap brews and no thrills end to the evening pre Uber back to our hotel! 
Drink prices were pre modern and on the cheap for the San Fran, then again we were post buying anything other then Highlife.
I slightly remember the conversations were post remembering them in the morning and the bar tender was post caring about being real polite since he was pre having to clean up after a very large full bar! 
All in all, I would be back. It's the perfect spot to cap off an already good night... Post Party!
author: Patrick T.

description:
This place is a real community.  

Bartenders are efficient like any good dive bar.  They are very friendly & chatty when they have the time, but, if they don't have the time to socialize you can guarantee the drinks are coming & they will be lovely.

Prices are freaking CHEAP without losing the quality.  

Jukebox is a rare treat in these digital days.

And they give.  Don't be surprised to wander into a fundraiser for some local worthy cause where a portion of the bar receipts & tips are given to make this world a better place.

Thanks Doc's Clock for being human & fighting to stick around.
author: Anne Marie M.

description: Wow.  The bartender we had the misfortune of observing was a man who totally hates his job, and anyone walking in for a drink.  Emotionally unstable, this guy is a Trainwreck - He snarled and yelled us about having our cash in hand like he was the bitter angry milk lady on her third shift at a school for ridiculous children.  We said f this and walked out without ordering - you win, cranky pants bar guy, hope this review prevents a few other nuisances and burdens (aka customers) away.
author: G D.

description: Priced right, dive bar, with hot specialty cocktails that warm you up like hot Apple pie
author: Meagan M.

description:
Not that I have to write another review criticizing this place because it looks like the job has already been done however because the staff was petty as hell I figure I might as well be too. We walked in and got a very unfriendly greet at the door where the bouncer couldn't even pause his conversation to check our ids and say thank you for doing so. We walked up and took two empty stools at the bar where we decided on drinks and got passed by a multitude of times. After waiting patiently for approx 15 minutes at the bar and seeing that the bartender had no interest in serving us we lost interest in spending our money there. The fact that she would rather pass customers by and proceed to loudly talk trash about other customers who she pegged as tourists to her regulars right next to us was also a turn off. We decided to leave, we got up and as we were leaving she yells "BYE THANK YOU GUYS!" Please tell me exactly what you're thanking us for? 

It's a shame, cool dive spot HORRIBLE SERVICE but if you're one of the types that enjoys sitting in a bar without a drink definitely the spot for you!!!
author: Sofy T.

description: It's always OK here I did take somebody who soon posted a picture of themselves there with somebody else this is not the place to seal any kinda deal, just pleasant and queer
author: Jennifer W.

description: I love this bar. It is all that is classic San Francisco mission. The staff takes care of you and it's in the perfect location.
author: Liz R.

description:
Cash only.  Don't expect anyone to come ask you for a drink order - you will need to go to the bar.  Which is fine, just something to expect.  Definitely more of a dive, but have a decent selection of drinks and my gin & tonic was well made.  Bathroom was pretty gross for 7pm on a Saturday. 

Nothing special to set this place apart - would not come back.
author: Kristin P.

description:
A nice little bar in the Mission. Inside are a few booths, a bar, and a shuffleboard table.

Been here a few times, the bartenders are friendly. There's not a large amount of seating available, but it's not bad. Drinks are cheap if that's what you're looking for, but you can also get something better here too. It is definitely an interesting interior, hilarious is how I've been describing the painting near the bar. Good spot to go out with friends on a random night.
author: Rajeev S.

description: I'd like to give it a zillion stars. Hands down the best place for a proper cocktail, a laugh, and good times. With friends it's fantastic, but I also find that it shines when I just want a nice bourbon out alone. If I'm thinking it's time to have a drink, I'm already on my way to Doc's. The new bar keeps the ambiance of the old bar, and that's not easy to do. Thank you Doc's.... you continue to bring the magic.
author: SisterMable S.

description: I love Doc's. It's a cozy home away from home where you can get away from all the precious craft cocktail spots that have been cropping up all over the City and have a good stiff drink with an unpretentious crowd. Whether coming here alone or with friends, a good time is always had. I also like that they regularly host fundraisers for neighborhood causes and local animal rescues. Oh! And it's dog friendly!
author: Amy B.

description:
Respect is not something you demand from customers by yelling & screaming at them. So I had just had a shot & started to feel a little warmer in this rainy weather. My friend touches a beat up Trump Pinata & then our night went sour real quick. (Someone else had already destroyed it before I stepped foot into this nasty place.) The bouncers were incredibly quick to judge & started yelling at us for touching a piece of trash pinata that was left on the side. They felt we "disrespected the bar." Bunch of candy fell out but we cleaned it up. Everyone was pretty much sober. No one was being biligerent or out of hand until we started being verbally attacked. We didn't do anything but clean up the candy off the floor when we got yelled at & she kept going. The other bouncer even joined in. Really professional guys.

I understand being upset someone ruined your precious Trump Pinata but you were yelling at the wrong people. We didn't know that piece of trash on the side was oh so important to you. Maybe you should have kept it behind the bar or in the back if you didn't want anyone messing with it? Reading from other reviews we're not the only ones to be treated this way by workers here. & what a coincidence, most of the other bad reviews are from or about people of color. Don't ever come here. Not worth the drama or the cheap drinks if you have to deal with these kind of people.
author: Vee L.

description:
After reading the other reviews, my bizarre experience here makes more sense.
TL;DR don't bother, especially as a non local.

Went in stone sober around 6:30pm, dressed very nondescript. Got cash from their ATM and sat down at the bar. I read their "Doc's Clocktails" board where they list 5-6 specialty cocktails with gimmicky names. There was one named the "[Something] Prohibition Highball," which I ordered. (First part of the name was illegible where I was sitting.)

Female bartender (must be the one others said is very unpleasant) laughed at me, acting confused and annoyed, and asked what I was talking about. I was baffled and explained I read it off their board. She goes, "ha, a Prohibition is a beer... a highball is a highball" and gesticulated dramatically, demanding I tell her which board I'd read it on.  Meanwhile she's making a big production out of scrutinizing my PA drivers license. I explain again, pointing at the board, and she finally turns and looks at it, the cocktail name staring her in the face. Without missing a beat she goes "well that's completely wrong. You know what, why don't you try another bar."

Her explanation was that my ID and my order were "weird." I'm in my mid 20s and have never gotten denied at a bar, at home or abroad. She clearly didn't know what the drink I ordered was, or didn't feel like making it, or was just messing with me as a non-local. Or maybe all of the above?

Lots of good bars in the area. Skip this one.
author: Alex T.

description: The best! Great bartenders, great drinks, great people! I was afraid it would go downhill after the move, but its still a perfect neighborhood bar
author: Margaret C.

description: By far the friendliest bar in the mission. Lisa was the most hospitable. I will definitely keep coming back.
author: Annemarie M.

description: Bartenders are awesome. A very comfortable place for everyone.Drinks are poured in an honest and profesional manner. I love this place and don't forget to be nice and tip your wonderful bartenders!
author: parker f.

description:
It's Always Time For A Cocktail! Yes! Yes! I agree Doc's Clock! A seedy place with a sense of humor totally characterizes this place. I bought my favorite grocery bag ever from here that says "Shut Your Whore Mouth" in cursive. It's just enough where people don't really read it but I feel better wearing it to.. oh say, a Whole Foods. At any rate, the cocktails were ok, even though I thought mine was a little watered down. Very dive. NEWSFLASH: you will not meet the love of your life in this bar!!!
Fun place though if you don't take yourself too seriously.
author: Monica C.

description: If I could give this place no stars I would , walked in with my cousins today to get a drink and the security at the door asked to see our IDs. I hand him my el salvador ID which I had to bring with me because I recently lost my wallet on the way to this place. He made a joke on me being illegal and laughed it off as if it was some type of joke. I grabbed my cousins and walked out not saying a word. He decided to step out behind us and claim he is "half mexican" some how thinking this is going to to make it alright, ive served in the military & given more then enough of my life to this nation to have someone treat me and my family in that manner. Luckily im involved in a lot of activism in MY neighborhood to get this news across. Hopefully for those reading you can have some understanding in what type of customer service youll get coming here. Ive been coming to docs for 5+ years this is now the end and my friends as well definitely agree, lost my business for the the rest of my LIFE!
author: Gary M.

description:
Lisa is an amazing bartender! Me and my room mate both work in the neighborhood and decided to stop by. The location is clean and well lit and laid out. Awesome beer selection with combos of shots and beer you can get. They also carry drinks you can order and the proceeds go to good causes. All around great place to hang out! Thanks again Lisa! 
Ashley from Alamo Drafthouse
Nicole from Purple Star
author: Ashley T.

description:
Ohhh Mission, you NEVER seem to fail me! 
I love the bay b/c of this area! 
Came for the weekend to visit my brothers. Since I haven't seen them for almost a year! 
One of them is fortunate to live in the Mission.  That's where I usually stay when I come and visit.  
We have always came here to grab a drink.  This was actually bar 4 on our bar hopping night.  I was sad to hear this establishment is closing after all these years.  

3 stars only because it was cash only.  I RARELY carry cash.  Luckily, I had a $20 for emergency.  

As I'm 5 years older than I was when I first came here, the bar seemed smaller.  Or I was buzzed.  Either way, I had good memories with my brothers in this bar.
author: Remie M.

description: Bartender is rude as fuuuuuuu*k ... I went in and asked what beer they have on tap.. telling her I'm legally blind at night time. She responded with  "next time you should bring you glasses." I'm not usually the type to write a bad review or say anything negative but I felt it was necessary this time.
author: Flower F.

description:
Bar is great: nicely low-lit, long with lots of stools, and fun games in back. Unfortunately when I went in the bartender was snippy to the point of being unwelcoming. It was starting to get busy plus the bartender was announcing to people to have their cash out and ready, so I decided to make things easier on him by ordering off the mixed drink menu on the chalkboard hanging behind the bar. He immediately snapped at me "I don't know what that is." Taken aback I told him it was on his board behind the bar. He turned his back to me and shrugged me off as if he didn't care and couldn't be bothered to mix a drink. I was so dumbfounded and felt so unwelcome that I walked out. He started yelling after me that it wasn't his fault because he's not been at work for a few days, but I didn't care. If this place is trying to be one with the kind of hardcore reputation where actual hospitality doesn't matter -- and that style of bar is a thing -- then they are a complete success. If that's not your thing, if all you want is a bartender to serve you a drink that they have listed on their own menu (and not some frou frou request), don't go here.

Update:
I read a bunch of Yelp reviews for Doc's Clock tonight and it seems the bartenders make a habit of abusing people who order off their chalkboard cocktail menu. I am not the first person who a bartender has told that they had no idea what the customer was talking about.

So, the chalkboard menu is a trap set up to give the bartenders a chance to abuse potential customers.

This is a level of bullshit that makes me want to burn the place to the ground. It's not funny. I burst into tears out in the street because the bartender was yelling at me as I was walking out the door. They are abusive bullies. The bartender was mean to me for no reason other than sport.
author: Laura L.

description:
Never have I been more appalled by the way my friends and I were spoken to/treated by one of the bartenders at this bar. There is nothing else to be said besides BAD ATTITUDE. This lady went nuts on us because I 1) wouldn't spit out my gum 2) didn't want to take out the ingredients for the drink I asked for. UM HELLO ISNT THAT YOUR JOB?!?!?!?!?!? 

She said "fuck this. I tried to help you (referring to her handing me a napkin to spit out my gum). I'm over this shit. I'm off. You're on your own" and then stormed away and was never served a drink. 

I wish this post was just a joke but it's true and people like that actually exist and work at this bar. So if you want to be yelled at and not given a drink for just existing, then you should come check this place out! Drinks r cheap so that's good?
author: Isabel B.

description:
If you look/sound fairly local and your drink choice only requires opening a can, this is probably an OK bar. If that's not you, expect to have attitude thrown at you by the bartender - and not in a way that can be written off as the bar's 'character'.

I thought the service we received might have been an off day, but after reading other reviews we won't be coming back. 

The bartender complained loudly about having to make any drink that involved pouring two things into a glass. She was also reluctant to make any of the drinks that were promoted on a poster right behind the bar and had something rude to say about us or our drinks choices every time, despite the fact we were tipping generously as she was the only bartender on duty.

Similar to another comment here, we also then experienced verbal abuse from the same bartender for not returning glasses to the bar, when one of us hadn't even finished drinking. 

The crowd is good and other patrons were talkative, but we noticed everyone was using the bar as a place to meet friends or stayed for just one drink. Now we know why.
author: Heather O.

description:
Great dive bar! 

I discovered Doc's Clock while waiting for my dinner reservation at Foreign Cinema. It's a no frills and unpretentious cash only bar with cheap drinks and friendly service. 

The dimly lit bar has some "interesting" decorations, some of which are NSFW. It's kind of a breath of fresh air, as compared to  some "fancier" bars out there in San Francisco and even in Mission District (ie. Laszlo across the street). 

As mentioned before, drinks are cheap. I believe they have a daily happy hour between 5-9pm, with half-priced well drinks ($3). 

Apparently a dentist owns (used to own?) the bar and that's where the name comes from. Anyways, it's a nice low-key bar to enjoy a cheap drink if you're in the area.
author: Arvid Y.

description:
Don't come here for fancy cocktails - it's not that kind of establishment. But do expect stiff drinks and rude bartenders - all part of the character of this dive bar.

Nice shuffleboard in the back, with plenty of seats and booths. Cash only - there's also an ATM in the back.
author: Vivian H.

description: Fun place, great crowd! Sean is a great bartender and always a pleasure. Definitely don't go when the long-blonde haired female bartender is working. She's incredibly rude and makes clear that if you're not one of her favored regulars, your presence is an inconvenience to her. If you see her, just walk out and head down the street to Mission Bar!
author: John O.

description: This is a great bar - when Lisa is working ! She's the real deal - warm, welcoming, knowledgeable and just a really fun woman. I have never written a Yelp review before but please try this bar when Lisa is there - she's very special.
author: Richard M.

description:
Happy hour till 9pm on Friday. Oh yeah!

Dive bar vibe. Super cheap drinks. ($3 for gin and tonic? HELL YEAH!) Cash only.

Like other bars, drop a tip and your next drink is super strong.

Great place to hang out and chill without breaking your bank.
author: Christina N.

description: Absolute dump with an absolute beach as a bartender....9 of us went here to spend the night drinking but left after 1.....the female bartender was a disgrace ....i cant understand how bar owners spend so much money opening these bars and then put complete assholes behind the bar.....its baffling....we would have spent hundreds in here but we ended up giving our money to The Gashead bar up the street,,,,,keep away if u wanna be treated like a piece of garbage
author: Captain C.

description: Doc's Clock is the awesomest bar on Mission St. It's been my fun happy place for a whole long time. Lisa makes it all go- so funny and such good peeps. One of these times, though, I'm gonna make beer come out of HER nose. I'm working on it.
author: Bernal R.

description:
Doc's is a total dive bar. Hell, the whole back area smells of pee. 

However, you can get a $2 PBR here during happy hour and they've got a Ms. Pac Man machine. I'm easy to please.
author: Casey S.

description: My go to place for a drink in Mission. Only gripe is they accept only cash.
author: Neha H.

description:
Bouncer was terribly rude and assuming. My friend tripped (he has broken both ankles and is just a little goofy-footed) and bouncer accused him of being wasted and advised him a couple times... Don't cause trouble in my bar! Before we had even gotten in there. I told him again... That no my friend was not drunk. "That's what they all say" was his response. 

Then while inside just hanging by the door trying to decide if we should even stay after that unkind welcome we chatted and waited for the bartender. There are few old and mangy pit bulls manning the door with unfriendly bouncer, which were harmless enough but make people nervous. 

Bartender was curt and then rudely handed me a bottle that still has the cap on it. (That's illegal isn't it?) she watched me struggle to twist it off using the cardboard coaster and didn't offer to help. I realized it was not a twist off and had to use my own bottle opener... Which she also just watched us struggle with (it's a small multi-purpose knife). I immediately took her tip back and then saw that she had won "best bartender" award in 2010 hanging on the wall. I think her times up with that accolade. 

I know people have bad nights, or back pain (that I heard her complain about to someone else)... But between the rude bouncer and the very unkind and seemingly malicious bartender... I'm fine not spending my money here..ever again. 

This place didn't seem like they cared one bit about people's experience. I feel a bit sorry for them, but my energy is likely wasted because they obviously did not give 2 shits.
author: Jey E.

description:
Seriously and honestly the WORST bar in SF. My experience was so surreal I am still wondering if I was on a show like Worst Bars in America or Worst Dive Bars Ever because it was that bad. First off, the sobering smell of hamster cage will hit you upon walking in. It's pretty pungent and gross. The bathrooms are on another level of disgusting with its sticky floors and piss laden toilets. 

The interior grossness is excusable for a dive bar with $3 drinks (well drinks). But the horrible service destroys any chance for decency.  The bartender Lisa or Lysa was utterly the worst garbage of a bartender EVER. Incredibly rude and aggressive from the moment we stepped in the bar. She gave my friends shit for not knowing what a PBR was. As if drinking Pabst was a sign of maturity or something. She also snidely remarked about me not tipping her when my friends purchased my drinks and between them tipped her $8 for three drinks equally $9 (greedy much). 

The peak of this ill-mannered thunderstorm that was passed off as service occurred when the bartender decided to go on break mid-service. She stepped out to get a cigarette and my friends decided to innocently pose behind the bar. One of the bartender's friend came and yelled at us asking what we were doing accusing us of stealing and ran off to find the bartender. When the bartender came back instead of asking us what happened, she starting going off on us accusing us of stealing and cursing and just being a level 10 bitch for no reason. She even took it racial and told me and my friends (the only minorities in the bar) to go back to "Compton". We were yelling back and forth at each other for a good 10 mins before she went uber racist and we just lost it. Needless to say we left the bar and wouldn't come back if the drinks were free and if they febrezed  the entire bar.  


I say come here if you want to be yelled at degraded and if  you want to  pick a fight. But DONT leave a tip especially when its not appreciated.
author: Jenelle B.

description:
Bring cash and bring your Fun.

One of the best dive bars I've ventured into.  Why you ask?

1/ It's a dive bar in the Mission....in SF...that's almost enough.
2/ PBR
3/ I like to play me some shuffleboard with my bros/ho's
4/ Should you desire a more intimate gaming experience, grab the Connect Four, 
    double fist some PBR and enjoy the tuneage quietly at your dive bar table.
5/ Good music....yeah....good music

Enough to make me want to schedule a business trip to SF right about now.
author: Lisa B.

description:
Dirty Frank's in Philadelphia is quite possibly my favorite bar on the planet.  Doc's Clock is like the San Francisco equivalent but with friendlier bartenders.

Come for the cheap beer and friendly crowd.  Stay for the local dranks and the ability to order half-pints if you're not in the mood for a full one.
author: Richie K.

description: When we first walked in here the bartender was verbally abusing a table of people for not returning their empty glasses to the bar. The bartender was yelling, "do you want me to wipe your asses too." It wasn't long until this individual started yelling at us to.
author: Jeremiah M.

description: I would give thisa zero if I could, what type of service/bar yells at customers for accidentally touching a TRUMP piñata? Making us patron, who ordered drinks feel terrible because a doll fell to the ground AFTER we cleaned the innards (candy) up. If you want to have a good time, don't go here. Fyi - you don't disrespect a bar when you clean the mess up yourself.
author: Tho N.

description:
Sometimes you really don't know the city as well as you think. Here I thought I knew the Mission until I realized that I have never been to Doc's Clock. Guess it was about time! 

With one of the longest bars I've seen and a fine list of on tap beers, Doc's Clock is a great little divey spot. Although quiet enough for our conversation, the place was pretty lively. From empty to crowded, people move through bar stools sipping pints and cocktails. 

My eyes always gravitate to people watching, checking out things on the wall and such. The little needlepoint over the register that said "Shut Your Whore Mouth" made me laugh and made me want to learn how to stitch.

And if you needed more excuses to try this place, the pints were about $4.00 and it's close to BART.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
The older woman bartender here is a real asshole.  

Was visiting two bartender friends in SF and they thought this would be a good place to check out.  I ordered a beer and the bartender told me I should try a sample first, I told her I didn't need to (since I've had the beer before), but she put one in front of me anyway.  "Oh she's making me" I said to my friends and we laughed.  The bartender didn't think it was as funny and said "Yeah, SHE is making you."  I got really nervous that I maybe called her a "he" and spent the next few minutes feeling awful for offending her.  Ordered another round and it was a beer that reminded me of the first time I hung out with the two friends I was with. Figured it was a chance to connect with her and told the anecdote when she brought the beer over.  "Wow, that's great. You owe me four bucks."

When she wasn't treating me like a dickhead, she was yelling at other paying customers for not being gentle enough with the jukebox or something. 

It was just off putting and really strange.  I've been to divey places where the bartenders don't take any shit, but this woman seemed to be seeking out altercations the whole night.    

One of my friends spent the majority of his time buttering her up and was able to do it effectively by letting her know he recognized her from coming into his bar.  We ended the night sharing a couple of shots with her and my two friends thought she was great.  I wasn't able to find any charm in her whatsoever and am left wishing I spit in her face while she was drinking the shot with us.
author: Mark T.

description:
What am amazingly awesome little dive bar!

Was in the area and up to no good, as typically will happen on the Sunday of a three day weekend.  Found out, through Yelp of course, that Doc's Clock had shuffleboard, so we were sold to mosey our way on over.

Cash only dive bar, no surprise, great locals, not too many hipsters, and...did I mention a scrabble board?!?  That's right, there's not just shuffleboard, but also Ms. Pacman, Pirates of the Carribean pinball, Scrabble, Connect Four, Jenga, Trivia Pursuit, and all other sorts of goodies to enjoy the night away.

And, hold the phone...  $2 PBRs!!

Yep.  Totally sold me over on this place.  Add in to that the awesome customers that made matching up with shuffleboard fun?  Totally sold.

For life.
author: Jes G.

description: Rad place to go out in SF to. Cash only of course...it's SF. However, cheap drinks! Some fun cocktail options too. There were 1 or 2 video games I think you could play like pacman, otherwise it's mostly a chill and hang out bar.
author: Kelly G.

description: Just a stinkin' good time whenever I come here.  Cheap drinks especially Sundays (all day happy hour!!) and they have arcade machines to pass the time.  Don't expect anything classy -- this is a dive bar after all -- but you get all sorts and it's always all good.
author: Janis P.

description:
Unpretentious and unassuming dive bar, perfect for a casual drink with good friends, old or new. 

Reasonably priced drinks, and a sort of wonky shuffle board table.
author: Patrick T.

description: If you love Dive Bars then this is the place.  We had a blast in here, the bartender was super nice and friendly... we had a few chats while she was on her smoke breaks.  They have lots of board games, pinball machine, pac man, and shuffle board... Which is RAD (Cuz yes I am a nerd).  We had a great time, with great service and I would definitely come back to this place.
author: Bryanna P.

description:
"Dive" here for "beer"-y good prices (cash only!)
They have shuffle board (just give the bartender your ID)
They have games like Connect 4 and Jenga to keep you entertained
author: Emily C.

description:
I truly believe anyone who gave this place more than two stars is smoking the PCP Rodney King had when he was pulled over. The "lady" bartender is the worse!!!


Don't GO HERE!!!
author: Jasmyn A.

description: This is a dive bar with a good atmosphere and friendly staff. Cash only, which kinda sucks, but what can you do. Easy to get to by walking or transit depending where you're coming from, since there are a bunch of buses along Mission and Doc's is also close to BART. Great place to hang out with friends
author: Bianca C.

description: Worst. Bartender. Ever.  When you work in the service industry, which both my husband and I have done in the past, it is all about tips.  Telling your patron f*** you, when they are just asking you a question, and asking said question nicely, not in a bitchy or patronizing way, is just rude and not a way to ensure a good tip.  This used to be a fun divey bar and we have been coming here on and off for 20 years, but no more.  But hey, it will probably get bought out any day now by a speculator looking to put up condos and honestly if it goes under - at this point - why should I care about preserving something unique if the people that work there don't even give enough of a damn to treat their patrons decently?
author: Laura M.

description: Good for a beer. Cash only. It's in a grimier part of the city but It has a lot of charm. Really cheap happy hours can't beat the shuffle board.  Good alternative for a drink if you don't the cocktails in the Alamo.
author: Zac B.

description:
This place sucks.  The door man declined a real California ID for no real reason, only really because it didn't "look the way his did".  There's no reason why I need to give my money to a place like this.  I think he was racist and thought all Asians look alike and that I was  using a fake ID.

Update after 3 months.
This place has 4 stars currently! I re-read all the reviews and it looks like there must have been a change in management or it's some strange social experiment they are pulling, but the majority of recent reviews are in line with my awful experience.

So sad to see a dive in the mission go to hell like this.
author: Jing L.

description: Terrible customer service. First time in. Bartender said 'talk to your bartender instead of your phone' and told my friend 'move your ass" to do something to the shuffleboard area. Hopefully you don't get the same jerk.
author: Tatum H.

description:
So, I went to a birthday event, and somehow ended up doing a mini-bar crawl and tacos run. Epic win FTW! Use this as a template. First stop was "Mission Bar". Second stop was "Lone Palm". This was the third stop - I was finally was buzzed enough to remember to take some pics. hah!

- It's not small, nor does seem cramped (http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/zSe1gmlRb8OfcdSJkwD5KA/l). 
- The people are fun, what with some movie projected on the back wall (http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/YXAPLFJwRAAudA4DtQ7GOQ/l)
- Shuffleboard (http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ujK6pA-0r2mMfDjnP2asAQ/l)!
- A video game machine (http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ObR1HpcwCwyEKProdt_8vQ/l) with four games!
The Krak 'n Cider (http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/xh3De8XPoH80-lcNO-ql1w/l) was awesome as it really helped my cold, hah! They also have Sunday brunches, called Three Papayas - Cultural Liberation Brunch, from noon to 5pm each Sunday.

On the way to the restroom, saw this blast from the past:  (http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/lpiIXD0n1Btdd5TZsmn0TQ/l). Wanna "Benny Hill" your youtube videos (http://bennyhillifier.com/)?
author: Peter L.

description: Bartender was more than happy to take our cash but then became a complete asshole when politely asked about the shuffleboard table. Thanks but never again.
author: Elise R.

description: Terrible service and incredibly rude bartenders. I'm a fan of dive bars but not this place.
author: Ben G.

description: Decent bar. Didn't have as many games as I expected, but it's a neat dive bar. Good bar to catch up and chat. Plus there's a bonus to having games of course. Bartenders are really nice. Cash only bar like so many bars in the mission. My friend had a really good time getting a high score there on one of the games that has a plane shooting at you and you're shooting at the plane. Something like that. Anywhoo, maybe it's better at a different time, but I liked it overall.
author: Julie L.

description: Docs clocks is the worst bar I've been to. The bartender is clearly unstable and consistently yelled at everyone in sight. Rude, inconsiderate, and overall uncalled for could sum up the service. I would avoid this place at all costs!
author: Shardae S.

description: Last time I was there, the bouncer was smoking with the front doors open. He may as well have been smoking in the bar since the smoke was just wafting in and filling the bar.
author: Wendy L.

description: Been my go-to for since 2012. Good prices. Good location. Got games. Over the years I noticed that all the familiar bartenders and bouncers are still chill and friendly while all the new faces are assholes. I miss the attic club...
author: Henry T.

description:
Came into this bar on Monday the 16th for the first time and despite the actual bar being cool (the Shuffle Board is a nice addition) the rude bartender ruined the experience for myself and the group of friends I was with. 

The management needs to educate the staff about "tips", tips are given for good service and even for Ok service. The bartender was tipped 20% (generous considering he messed up the order which was written down on a piece of paper, numerous times) but failed to recognise this before he insulted a member of the group based on her nationality for not tipping when she had.

Other reviews have also highlighted this issue. Good service = Tips.

Will never be coming back to this bar especially when surrounding bars offer superior and friendly service
author: Erin M.

description:
The Clock means business. Always efficient and friendly service. The drinks are strong and cheap. Bourbon/coke $6 bucks. Beer. Cheap cheap cheap. 

Shuffleboard and always a friendly drunkard sitting on next you
author: Sigorney S.

description: I wish there is a 0 star option because this bar deserves a 0. Went there one night with a friend and received the rudest service at any bar. I called the bartender a 'sir' by mistake and she was clearly offended (in my defense, the room was dark and I apologized right after she corrected me). I had 2 drinks thus far and would like to try something new, so I asked the bartender for a recommendation for a well drink. She looked at me and asked me if I heard of a thing called Google, and walked away. I waited for a while for her to come back but she didn't, so I waved my hand to get her attention and when she came by, she asked if I learned my patience yet. I was very angry at that point but I didn't want to make a scene, so I said 'yes, and I would like a Long Island please'. She said you should eat first because that will mess you up, and walked away.. At that point, Its obvious she does not want to serve me and I have had enough of her attitude, and so I got up and left. Yes this place have cheap drinks during happy hour, but the service killed it for me. I tipped well and tried to be as polite as possible, but that bartender had some serious problems. Would not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Jack W.

description: 4 stars for having shuffle board! Eff yeah! The vibe is very relaxed and casual, good beer selection and friendly crowd. Not sure if the pit bull walking around is a regular customer, but it was really friendly and cute!
author: Judy L.

description:
I liked the space.  The crowd was cool too.  But man... I have never experienced such a rude and VICIOUS bartender.  She yelled at my friend for only tipping 10% after our first round.  We go out a lot and usually start slow.  If she wasn't the most terrible human being I have ever come across I'm sure she would have ended up with at least 20% tips from us... like we always do.  We understand that tips are a bartenders livelihood, because, well, my friend who the bartender berated is a bartender himself.

We drank our drinks and left.  So did the people next to us who were scared to death of the bartender after she ruthlessly ripped into my friend and tried to embarrass him in front of other bar patrons.  Jokes on her though in the end, I saw other people flicking her off behind her back!  Maybe we weren't the only people she mistreated?  LOL.

I would love to go back... but I think I'm too scared.
author: Dave M.

description: Personable bartenders, great dive bar. Love the décor and the random barbies everywhere. Definitely coming back on a regular basis!
author: Zara S.

description: Great happy hour specials: well drinks $3!!!  That's retro 1980's pricing. The bar was pretty empty at 5:30 on a Tuesday.
author: Amy W.

description: Neat divey bar with cheap drinks and random games, ranging from shuffleboard to connect four. I saw a bunch of people eating pizza so i think you're free to just bring pizza inside.
author: Misha T.

description:
Doc's Clock, you win life. You already had me hooked with your fun game selection - Pacman, pinball, shuffleboard, drinking Jenna and more. But then you offered a large selection of warm winter drinks and I fell in love. Yep, you won me over with that krak'n cider. 

So there you have it boys and girls. Doc's Clock is a chill, fun dive with good drinks. Stop by and fall in love.
author: Talia G.

description: Dope spot can't complain, chill atmosphere great place to meet up with friends and get a quick drink. Oh one more thing drinks are super cheap
author: Kency A.

description: Solid dive bar option.  As others have said, cash only (which is to be expected), cheap strong drinks, good bartenders, friendly clientele and happy hour till 8pm even on Saturday's.  $2 cans of Olympia? Why not.
author: Nick G.

description:
Eh, how about a huge big sign that says we only take cash before I have to come inside. That would be great.

The staff is friendly enough, and the drink are your usual, but considering the other better places around I am not sure why you would choose this place over any of the others that will happily take my plastic.
author: Luis D.

description: The bartender was very rude.  I wouldn't go there. Many more bars in the city to choose. Some Midwest "girlfriend" got a job there and she may have had too much of "San Fran" for her own good!
author: Kari S.

description:
Dive bar.  Shuffleboard.  Juke Box.  Cheap beers.  Happy Hours.  Decent Selection.  Hipster Crowd.  Booths and tables.  

These things pretty much define my favorite bars, so apparently Doc's Clock is one of my new favorite Mission haunts.  And to play shuffleboard on a Sunday we just had to exchange our ID for the pucks...hey-o free game!  And we met some likeminded strangers who challenged us to a game until the rest of our party arrived.  The jukebox has a good mix of artists/genres.

I may brave this place on a weekend night for comparison, but on a Sunday evening with a few people at the bar and one other group at a booth, we had room to move around and table hop as the shuffleboard got heated.  Oh, the table is slightly warped though, so if you're hardcore about your shuffleboard, you've been warned.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: I love everything about this place, except that their doorman (the scrawny one with the black hair) is a total jerk. But their bartender Lisa is awesome, and the rest of the crew seems pretty cool too.
author: Dave R.

description: So much freakin fun. Love the Mission, never been to this particular spot. The manfriend said it was awesome, so in we went. This bar has a ton of character with a lot of SF history/culture, and the bartender, Lisa, is AMAZZINGG. Perfect place to chill, play games, have a beer and great conversation with all. I most definitely encourage everyone to stop in!!
author: Stephanie M.

description: Dark, divey-ish bar with great staff. It's cash only, like a lot of bars in this genre in San Francisco. The music selection was good, the crowd chill and the bartenders attentive. They make good drinks and I would def go back.
author: AT P.

description: I have no idea why this place has a scotch menu when the bartender completely ignores the order and just gives you a scotch ale instead, despite numerous protests that what I wanted was, in fact, a Bruichladdich.  Granted, I realize that that's not the easiest word in the world to understand, but the response is to not pretend you heard something - again, after numerous attempts to explain how the bartender was wrong - and just go through with it.  This is not a "Oh I misheard" type of situation, but rather a "Oh, I'm not even going to try" type of situation.  Of course, neither is acceptable when you're in an area as hyper competitive for getting people drunk as the Mission.
author: Norman S.

description:
I love this place. I somehow always end up at Doc's Clock when back in San Francisco because everything about it is excellent. The neon sign, the shuffleboard and random board games, a badass jukebox (no newfangled TouchTunes here) with Sleater-Kinney, Dead Kennedys, and Otis Redding - it's all aces. 

Happy hour is daily (!) from 5-9pm, with well drinks 1/2 price. That's right, 3 bucks a pop for my whiskey diet coke. Doc's also sports some pretty solid top shelf choices, including emphasizing the local with Hangar 1 vodka and Anchor Distillery selections. Props for the monthly doggie happy hours, with 50% of the bar donated to a local dog rescue and they are a SF certified green business. 

Doc's Clock might be elevating the dive bar, but don't get it twisted - cash only, now and forever.
author: Emily G.

description: Nice dive bar on mission street. Tables and shuffleboard in the back and plenty of quick eats nearby to help you through your night. Bartender was friendly and speedy which nicely countered the craft beer loving crowd who demand a lot of attention. Will go back if I'm in the neighborhood but apparently the bar is closing shortly.
author: Mike S.

description:
Cash only bar. Fun environment for a chill night. They have a few games inside...shuffleboard, Ms. Pacman, Connect Four and a few other fun ones.

I played connect four which was awesome, one of my fave games to play at home while drinking/chilling. Had a moscow mule, it was good although tasted like it had no alcohol :( Good crowd. Music playing.

I would come back!
author: Lina K.

description:
Started the night here, wasn't all that impressed. 

Pros: 

1) Cool games 
2) No cover
2) Diverse crowd of people and space to talk to them! 

Cons: 

1) They were out of their signature bar beer Anchor Steam... how is that possible? Replacement recommendation from bartender was terrible. 

2) They served some strange IPA in a Chimay glass. Again, who does that at a bar? 
This isn't some house party where "all of the other glasses are dirty" is a valid excuse. 

3) The connect 4 game didn't work :(

I probably was there on a bad night.
author: Ryan V.

description:
Any bar that makes decisions about who can come in based on race is no place for me. I was completely mortified last night when the bouncer did not allow one of our friends to come in reasoning that she was "too brown" in her ID picture. She was the last in our group of eight people to enter when the bouncer denied her entrance. Unfortunately everyone who entered before her was white and there was no problem with anyone else's ID. Honestly, not being let into the bar was whatever we just took our business somewhere else. However, the fact that the bouncers reasoning for denying her entrance was because of her race was absolutely unacceptable. If he thought the ID was fake he could have said something else, asked her a question about the ID, or called the cops and let them decide if it was a fake ID or not but instead he decided to deny her based on race. I didn't know people like that existed in San Francisco but after last night I was proven wrong. 
After the situation occurred I wanted to read other reviews of the bar to see what others had to say. The place has pretty good reviews however the bad reviews all dealt with different racial slurs and commentary made by the bouncer and some bartenders. I think reading that others have been denied entrance based on race, told to "go back to Compton", or that there have been multiple times that they have denied darker Asian women from coming in, makes the situation a million times worse. Because now it just proves that racism is an underlying theme of this bar and that the bouncer didn't just accidentally use the wrong terminology when denying her entrance. He honestly felt the way he did. I guess you can't change racist people but I will chose to not support a racist place like this.
author: Briana N.

description: What a great bar. I haven't been to a packed place and was able to get a drink in under 4 min in forever. That's how get it done. And free soda water. Served fast! WTH? And they were donating half their proceeds to the Mission fire victims. You guys rock! Thanks for the hospitality
author: Nicole O.

description: This place was awful. The bouncer/manager was really rude and yelled at our table because we place our pizza box for min to on the jukebox to organize the plates. Get it, but you can tell or ask us to put the box on the table without screaming. Rude service all round.
author: Jacqwi C.

description:
Stepped in, ordered a Jameson, read Dostoevsky.

The bartender chatted me up intermittently, left me to my book when needed, brought me water when I was feeling parched, and poured me another Jameson... just because.

How can I NOT love this place?
author: Adena B.

description: This place is one of the last true San Francisco Dive Bars. Lisa, the bartender, is a fine mixologist and a kind person. They have regular dog rescue events and so far, it is blissfully free of the millennial hipsters who have ruined The Mission. In fact, judging by the people who wrote the negative reviews, they would rather not be here, which is JUST FINE with me. This place is homey, fun and the drinks are well-crafted with fair prices. What a hidden gem!
author: Susan T.

description: Pretty slow for St. Paddy's day. Cash only, but fair prices.
author: Greg F.

description:
Shut Your Whore Mouth.

No, not you.* That's just what the embroidered sign behind the bar says.

At first, I hated this bar. Not because of the sign, that's clearly fantastic. Mostly because they were screening an independent movie that seemed to consist only of shots of a passing train, a man tearing apart a chicken with his hands, and various rodeo activities. This would not have been a problem if it was not accompanied by a score comprised of DEAFENING mooing.

When I yelled over the mooing, "What the FUCK is this bullshit?" The guy to my left kindly informed me that the "filmmaker" was sitting on the other side of him. Luckily, she didn't hear because of her absurdly loud soundtrack choices.

Doc's Clock improved dramatically after that screening ended. The bartender is appealingly grumpy, they serve up $2 pints of PBR which are ideal for a chugging relay race (that my team won, of course), and the next film featured women in lingerie involved in a lot of spanking and eventually, dildo-sucking. Which could still be construed as offensive to some, but I found it to be marginally more palatable, as I could hear what my friends were saying.

I didn't even have to make any of that up. 
_________

*Actually...yes. You.
author: Peter D.

description:
Doc's Clock is everything I like in a Mission bar. Hilarious staff, strong drinks, an unpretentious crowd that was always busy, but no line spilling out the door like the places up the street. 

It gets a little jammed near the bar (I swear, there's some law in the city saying you can't have more than four feet between the bar and the wall), but they have a great draft beer selection if that's your bag. It's hidden away a bit amongst all the noise on Mission, so I feel like I wouldn't have found this place otherwise, but if I need a pint in the Mission that's fairly priced (we all ordered beers/cocktails and I don't think anything came out to over $5, bless), I'll likely be back to Doc's Clock
author: Kevin B.

description:
Any bar that has a hand cross-stitched sign that is framed and hung behind the bar that reads "Shut Your Whore Mouth" instantly gets at least 4 stars.

Sadly I was not there long enough to do more exploring, but overall this is just the kind of dive that I like.  They also have a better than average selection of beers for a dive and good happy hour deals.

I shall be returning soon.
author: Brian E.

description: The atmosphere here is a bit weird.  Dark (not like interesting, emo dark... just literally a bit hard to see) and a bit dingy.  That's part of what people find as its charm, I suppose.  But the whole feel was a bit depressing.  Also, when I was there, there was a grand total of 6 people at the bar, but the bartender was wildly inattentive.  I felt like I was inconveniencing her by ordering beer.   When I had a question about a certain tap, she was visibly annoyed that I asked.  Prices aren't bad, but it's not a place I'd go on purpose again.
author: Tarah D.

description: Inexpensive drinks, good vibe... but it gets very crowded and not the best beer selection.  The happy hour is long and every day, which is outstanding!  The games at the back are cool too.
author: Allison M.

description: What the F! Came in for a happy hour drink. Treated us like we just got off the the Google bus. Sorry I didn't have drink order memorized. I have lived in SF for over 20 years, not the kind of hospitality I expect to find when grabbing a local drink.
author: Resto L.

description:
"What's that place? Clock's Dock? Knock Clock? Ah, Doc's Clock!!"

Cheap $6 cocktails, friendly chill bartenders, games (arcade and board), eco-conscious "turn off the lights!" sticker in the bathroom!

Cash only, hit the ATM beforehand! Moderately crowded on a Friday around 9ish, but could find a table without waiting too long.
author: Suejung S.

description:
Splaloosh!
Doc's Clock gots me that way. That way is wanting to fall on the sidewalk and just sleep there. (oh the sweet embrace of concrete, I could love you) In the morning the headache still told me that it was a good idea. In retrospect it would have been the end of me.
Doc's Clock is a dive and it is hipster happy. It's a fine place to get a drink, they even have cheap champagne! That my friends is what separates this joint froms the others on the block.
Cool place
author: Alexander R.

description: came here many years ago, im a fan dont drink anymore so not my stomping grounds these days
author: Leigh G.

description:
I probably shouldn't feel comfortable in this bar but it just so happens that I do.
It's never really crowded and that's unfortunate because it is the kind of bar you can make your home. You shouldn't make any bar your home, but if you're like me and you can't live with out beer after a really long day...this is the bar for you.

It doesn't really follow a theme (which I like) .
It's located near 24th Street Bart (which I like).
The bartender was super nice when he kicked us on New Years ( which I like).
The bar is also near someone that I like ( which I really  like).

Drama free, dimly lit, cheap drinks. That's all I ask.

Oh, Cash only. Don't be the douche who throws your card on the counter . Doing something like that would justify the parental tone from your pal who is a regular.
author: Hannah A.

description:
Love this place.

Cash only, full bar, awesome bartenders, plenty of space, SHUFFLEBOARD!, board games, jukebox, and cheap drinks. Who doesn't enjoy a 2 dollar Olympia while playing shuffleboard or a board game?
author: Zoe H.

description:
They have a pacman table! I understand that it's just plexiglass over an old arcade game, but still fun. Shuffleboard too!

Sweet happy hour drinks. We had $3 porters. The place definitely felt like it could be a sports bar structurally, but instead of big screens, there are murals and hipsters. Nice chill place to conversate.
author: Kevin L.

description:
There are two reasons I love this bar:

1) They have the best happy hour in town. 

Monday-Saturday 6-9 PM and all day Sunday

$2 PBR
$3 drafts
$3 well drinks
$5 Chimay

That's right, three dollar Anchor Steam until 9 PM

2) Once a month they have a charity happy hour and silent auction to benefit an animal cause. 50% of all drink money and 100% of the auction goes to the Charity

Each of those reasons deserve five stars so I give them TEN stars.
author: Manny F.

description:
Normally i like this place.  But the bartender on monday nite (dec 16th) was awful. There was a big group of us, probably 10 - 12 people, a mixture of english, irish  and american, with at least half of us all bartenders. It can be daunting when that many people want served at the one time, but we were organized and had the money and drink order already together. it was all shots and only two of us(one english, one irish) actually went to the bar to place the order, to make it easier. Pretty straight forward. 

But the bartender had serious attitude. After he had mispoured a drink (and acted like it was our fault,. - don julio gold instead of blanco, which any good bartender knows, you always ask dark/white when you have both types of a brand) poured a drink we didnt ask for, and missed one completely, we paid our $50+ tab, left a $10 tip and did our shots. 
As we turn around to leave, he leans over the bar and says "Just so you know, in this country, its customary to tip the bartender". 
Seriously??
At this point am too shocked by his rude behavior to say anything other than "but i just left you $10". His response - "oh, that was you.... ok.  ....thanks" 

There was nobody else around us!!! who else do you think left it????? 

I dont know what this guys problem was, but next time i think we.ll just keep walking to the next bar instead.
And now, that's at least 7 bars in the neighborhood that will not be recommending Doc's Clock to anybody.
author: J F.

description: Good beer at good prices. Interesting, funny decor with that feeling that people love the place and want to make it welcoming. The service experience was kind of manic - she was attentive, full of suggestions, chatty but she was also having some sort of conflict with a buzzed guy sitting next to us (told his friend to get him the hell out of there) and at one point she got testy with me for "interrupting" her, which surprised me because I thought we were having a conversation and I wanted to point something out. I would go back though, because everyone has an off day.
author: Linda F.

description: The place rocks, the bartenders rock, and the cheap drink prices are legit for what's popping up in the neighborhood.  The nightly specials are fucking awesome (4 roses bourbon for $4 all day Tuesdays? That's a steal).  So long as things remain the same at Doc's, it will forever be my go-to bar in the area.
author: Keith P.

description:
Definition of sacrilege: A bar in the Mission running out of PBR. Seriously, PBR paraphernalia all up in the whole bar, your "drink special" chalk board outside says PBR... so where the hell is it? Lame.

Last night came to the conclusion with a group of folks that at night, when the bar closes, ghost cats take over the place to party. Like a ghost cat after hours. They show up, get hammered, do lines of catnip, and then pee all over the back of the bar. There has to be some logical, scientific reason for why it smells like cat pee everywhere, and this is what we came up with. Sorry Doc's, but maybe you should put out some ghost cat litter boxes or something. Doc's used to just smell like feet, but it's somehow morphed to cat pee. Not sure if that's an upgrade. 

On the positive side, rocked some serious Lord of the Rings pinball. I love pinball because no one really knows how the scoring works. Sometime special sounds or lights go off, a ramp opens, or the score board says something like "Secret Cave Adventure Bonus x200!!!". Everyone agrees, you just "try and hit stuff". So I have no clue what all the Lord of the Rings stuff is really, but I'm all drunk like "Yeaaa, Gimli bonus woooo!" or "Oh man, did you see that 'Ent War' ramp bonus? So sweet." Had an entertaining conversation about what the full name is of the Elf chick played by Liv Tyler and we settled on Arwen Sexyface. Her face is like smack under the right paddle and she's staring straight up at you. Kinda creepy if you're drunk enough.

Between pinball, board games, table shuffleboard and PBR specials (when they aren't out of it), I do like Doc's. I ignore whatever the funky smell of the month is and always end up having a good time. Mellow crowd too, very social. Plus, it's the only bar I know of where I can yell things like "Oh man, I whooped that Balrog's ass" and not be looked at like I'm mental.
author: Justin N.

description:
Happy Hour. ($3 well drinks, $1 off of drafts, and $2 PBRs)

Games. 

Darkness. 

Friendly Bartender. 

I wish I were there right now.
author: Emily D.

description: I grew up in the Mission/Bernal (~30 years) area and I'm disappointed in not discovering this spot sooner.  It's divey, hipster with just the right amount of shitty to add to its charm.  Its busy, but not overly crowded on the Friday night I was there.  Bartender w/ the long beard was attentive and helpful.  Drinks were cheap and potent.  Apparently, the owner gives back to the SFSPCA; a huge plus for a dog lover like myself.
author: Leland H.

description:
My low star review is only about the woman bartender I had when I went in this last weekend for my 21st birthday  - I normally love this place.

I came here around 9:45 Tuesday night to start off my 21st birthday. I hand my ID to the woman bartender and she tells me that she can't serve me until midnight. This is such crap because midnight on my birthday wouldn't be my birthday any more. I asked if she meant midnight on the night before and she said no. She said it was CA law and that she couldn't serve me. I was so angry because that is not the law so I fought her on it and she wouldn't budge. She ended up saying she would "be nice to me" and sell the drink to my friend and I could secretly take it but it was just such bullshit to have to go through it. She came over later and yelled "21 year old bitches" at us. 

I went to many other bars that night which all let me in because, duh, you are allowed in on your 21st birthday. Very disappointed and sad in this service because I normally love this place. She definitely ruined it for me. Bummer!
author: Simona M.

description:
I've been here at least twice... my first time was a pretty average experience. Was with one other friend, cheap cocktails, whatevs. 

I came here with a large group on a weekday night as a friend was back in town. We were visibly their main source of business that night. No one was obnoxiously drunk or anything but a couple drinks had been spilled by some people. My friend was really apologetic about it and grabbed a handful of napkins to start cleaning it up as it was dripping all over the place, and the bartender scowled "Don't waste a tree!" or something like that and grabbed a towel. I'm all for saving trees, but don't be a dick, be quicker with the towel, and, like, don't be a dick. 

Also, don't try to order a vodka + diet tonic here, the bartender will just look at you confused (it's as if he either doesn't know a diet version exists or that you can drink tonic with alcohol other than gin. ok fine mostly he just can't hear you) and suggest a vodka + diet coke, which just sounds disgusting. 

Anyway, I really don't know why I'd go back here. Cheap drinks are hardly a selling point when they're standard drinks I can make for cheaper at home, without the 'tude.
author: Richa A.

description:
Any bar with shuffleboard is alright with me. The bartender was hella cool and poured stiff tasty drinks. The vibe was chill and relaxed. 

I'm all about it and would definitely return.
author: Kiristen R.

description: A great, affordable dive bar that's easy to socialize in - especially after losing your hearing at Lazlo across the street. Treated friends to a scotch, rum and coke and g+t for...$12. Amen.
author: Andrew K.

description: Didn't seem that divey to me... drinks were kinda soft and wasn't much there...
author: Adidas W.

description:
My favorite Mission Bar! (other than Mission Bar, of course.) I am a huge fan of all things dive-y, dirty and in the Mish. I discovered this lovely spot after a crazy night of theater at The Dark Room. The drinks are strong, the happy hour is LONG and the price is oh hell yes. Bring a $20, leave drunk and happy. I love this place because if you're a teetotaler like me, you appreciate a cool dark bar that you can crawl into and curl up in right after work to drown your sorrows with a nice cold pint (of which they have several crafty types on tap!) It's very nice before 8, very few hipsters, just the regulars and the die-hard drunks. :) Oh. and don't be dumb. What good Mission bar takes cards? Use your brains, stupid tourists, and get the hell our of my neighborhood with that fancy plastic stuff.

EDIT: they have Anderson Valley Winter Solstice Cerveza Crema on tap. I DIE.
author: Miquela S.

description:
Time for some complex algebra:

[(Mission + Hipsters) / (Shuffleboard + Board Games)] + [(Surly Bartender - selection of booze) + (Hipsters x Juke filled with punk)] = Ironic but good, in a dirty, ironic way.

There's a needle-point sign above the bar that reads "Shut Your Whore Mouth". That's worth an extra star right there.
author: Don B.

description: About as good as you can get for a dive bar.  Great location, very cheap drinks, nice homey service.
author: Ric S.

description: Best place. Friendly bartenders, always. Especially Lisa. Jukebox has a good range of different types of tunes. All in all, very easy going type of place. I enjoy it every time.
author: Alyssa J.

description:
Really pleasant staff.  
Nice long bar.
Friendly crowd.  
Great Happy Hour prices.
author: Jag A.

description:
A great down to the earth dive bar that I love! Good selection and good people behind the bar. 
Only one thing -- Cash only (thats the star off) 
Great bar! My local...
author: Lonnie T.

description: Came here the other night for happy hour. Pleased to find $3 well drinks that were actually worth more than $3. Pleased to learn that HH lasts from 5-9 daily, giving us peons who work for a living time to enjoy it. And pleased to hear Doc's cares about the community: it's a green business, and it hosts HHs that benefit animal charities. That's pretty cool in my book.
author: Allison B.

description:
Great Bar! Came here on a Friday Night - place was packed and drinks were cheap! Vanilla Vodka Coke and a Vodka Soda for $10 and they appeared to be quite stiff! One of the better bars I visited on Mission!

Plus - they even allow dogs in the bar!
author: Brian D.

description: This review is based on a few awesome things that made this a shined turd among dive bars: 1. any place where the bartender playlist has Slapshot 'Hang up your Boots' and other hardcore once in a while just makes me happy 2. any place where the bartender is from the east coast just makes me happy. 3. any place with shuffleboard makes me happy 4. cheap beers make me happy
author: A A.

description:
a favorite dark divey hangout for pre-parties and meet ups. I love the strong drinks, the board games, and the shuffle puck and the fact that they did not kick us out for inventing a game entitled wafflepuck for a scavenger hunt task.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hj_SLylSphQ
author: Nikki M.

description:
It. Was. Packed.

I came here for a celebration! It was amazing. And also a small world, because one of my coworkers was there, at the same time, for ANOTHER party. Of course, Jaime was driving and therefore not drinking. But I managed to sit down with Janney, Fong, Keane, and some other cool cats I didn't know. One guy actually introduced himself and interrupted my conversation to tell me I had french bangs and I was one of the most beautiful girls he's ever seen. Um, thanks? 

Then I pointed out a guy I thought was unbelievably attractive, was apparently loud enough for him to hear me because next thing you know he's pointing to me and this girl is glaring in my direction. OH HEY KEANE MY WONDERFUL BOYFRIEND HOW ARE YOUUU! (thanks for being there for that). 

The guy who told me I had french bangs asked me to join him and his friends at the 500 Club to blow some coke, and I turned him down because if I ever do a hard drug more than likely I'll fucking kill myself. Here's the conversation:

"Hey, you want to go blow some coke at the 500 Club with us?"
"Sorry man, I'll kill myself. But thanks!"
"You know, you're beautiful, but it's not like that means anything in this cold, cold world. And beauty goes hand in hand with intelligence, but I just don't see much of that with you."

Why do you need to go to the 500 Club? It seems like you've already been snorting. You got a little..um...white stuff..*points to nose* right there. 

Then to top off the evening, I was dared to go up and ask these guys if they were wearing cologne, because someone was wearing an amazing scent and I wanted to know who it was. None of them, but they invited me out to Wish, and I would have gone but I ate a bacon dog instead.
author: Jaime L.

description:
The first time I went to Doc's Clock was merely by chance.  A couple of us stumbled in there while to kill time waiting for some other people to meet us in the Mission.  A friend who was with me said the next day that my words were so slurred and unintelligible that he thought I had been roofied.  Guess their drinks do the job!  

The next time I went to Doc's Clock was because said roofie-accuser had developed a strange love for (a) the shuffleboard table and (b) this owl picture that sits in the corner above the bar on the left side.  While I am skeptical of any activity like shuffleboard that rewards participants for being weak, I ended up having another solid time here. 

Now I go to Doc's Clock because I have realized it is pretty awesome -- never super crowded, generally innocuous clientele, spacious interior, large bar, etc.  I don't live or really frequent in the Mission (and when I do go there I prefer to be a little farther west if I can help it) so I'll probably never be a regular.  Close to BART as well. 

I won't go so far as to write home about the place, but I will write this review.  Not exactly worth going out of your way for (there's a good dive in most neighborhoods, no?)  but it's a definitely solid choice if you are in the area.
author: Molly B.

description:
They open at 4pm on Friday, before Make Out Room or Shotwells.

Unusually good selection of local, artisinal distilled beverages. Summer 2012, local go-to drink is "summer salad" some parts cucumber vodka, basil vodka, ginger ale base, some tonic. 

Adorable "public teacher happy hour" pricing. Intriguing use of "tres leches" liqueur in various cocktails: Very personable bartender, authentic mission vibe. This bar has been a fixture for years, and will be for years to come, a mission standby.

Can be intolerablly crowded on the weekends and, let's face it, when normal people are out of work and wanting to party on the weekends. Don't discount it though,they throw down for real.
author: Allonsy A.

description: Pretty good  Mission dive bar. They have  pinball and shuffleboard table to keep you entertained. We played pinball for hours,  but we  really wanted to play shuffleboard. Unfortunately we were on the bottom of a very long list and never got to play. The drinks are priced well and come in pint glassses, which is rare for SF. The atmosphere is fun and the crowd is young and friendly. The bathrooms are very gross though and they only have one stall for men and one for women. With nicer bathrooms this place could have received 4 stars.
author: Jena M.

description: Shuffleboard! Good service. Fun atmosphere. Lots of good food nearby. Definitely one of the better Mission bars.
author: Patrick S.

description: Came here on a Saturday afternoon, the day after they had some bizarre "mutilate Barbie" party, so there were random, disfigured Barbies everywhere. they had a decent selection of beers and alcohol - we were there during Happy Hour and had a blast!
author: Tammy S.

description:
This place always surprises me. It's divey, lurking there near 22nd but cheap, cheap cheap. Nothing fancy, just a long bar, shuffle board, and friendly staff.

I also appreciate that they have a large collection of local booze. Ask around and check out the range, you will find a lot of stuff made within 100 miles.

And yeah, the bar only takes cash. Just about every bar in the city is like this. that;s the way it is, get used to it.
author: Geoff H.

description:
Sat night - 11 PM - and Doc's Clock was full of fun-loving people. A good crowd playing shuffleboard and having a few beers. Not too hipster!

Best part of the night - running into PAWS and playing with the adorable dogs they brought along. Dog-friendly bar? YES!
author: Madeline N.

description:
Always a good time (and buzz) at Doc's. Super chill atmosphere, cool-ass bartenders and a long bar to sit yer butt down and drink to be merry.

The best part is the embroidered sign on the wall behind the bar. It reads: Shut Your Whore Mouth. Any bar that has that up is worthy.
author: Meredith R.

description:
When I got kidnapped from a DYL by 3 beautiful women and brought here, one commented that I was either brave or insane. My response was that regardless of how the night turned out, it would make a great story! (Cop: Wait...he was "kidnapped" by 3 women? Wherever he is, he's probably thrilled and doesn't want to be rescued.)

Given that I had a great time hanging out with all of them at Doc's Clock, that assessment would be perfectly accurate. The velvet curtains near the door created a classy feel, accentuated by the dim but adequate lighting. Bartenders were efficient, drinks we well-priced, and my vodka Collins was perfect. The narrow walkway along the length of the bar creates a choke point near the door, but the bar opens up in back into several tables and booths. Bathroom in the back was narrow and graffiti'd, but clean and otherwise fine; no complaints.

This bar is a great place to hang out--in addition to good drinks, they have a jukebox, a LARGE pile of board games (including my favorite, Scattergories), and a shuffleboard table. I rocked a perfect winning throw one game that earned me a beer in admiration from my opponent! 

Next time I'm in the Mission, Doc's will be high on my list of bars to visit!

TRIVIA: I have no idea the origin of the bar's name, but it makes me think of "Back to the Future", and that alone makes it cool. This place is 1.21 jigawatts of fun!
author: Bill B.

description:
Friendly bartenders and good prices. Also, a great selection on the juke box.

 Unfortunately, last time I went here (possibly my mistake b/c it was a friday) this place had turned into Jock's Clock! What the heck. Too many dudes with flip flops =/

 I guess it isn't the bar's fault...
author: Leuwam T.

description: Went to Docs Clock last (11/7/15) night to support Muttville that had a fundraiser/silent auction to raise money for shelter dogs. One of the supportors, a woman that was well dressed and about 40 something, went out side.....4 steps outside the door to calm a dog that was tied up. Apparently she had a glass of wine in her hand and the bartender, Lisa I believe, started screaming at this poor woman about bringing her drink outside the bar. The woman looked shocked and brought the drink back in the bar and apologized. The woman behind the bar went of on her....calling her a F-ing asshole and a f-ing C word. People at the bar were mortified including the dog rescue group she was attending with. Then she would not drop it.....she threw the woman out of the bar. The woman was crying, she was with a group of shocked friends and the bartender is still going off on her. I felt so bad for her....the majority of us left at that point. I am thankful to Docs for supporting dog rescue groups but will never go back there again with that unstable person behind the bar. To bad, seems like a decent dive bar minus the staff.
author: Shawn K.

description: I love this bar. My preference is dive bars with good style. A little ghetto fabulous. Shuffle board and table video games. He tamale lady with her out of this world tamales. Dark and grungy. Love it. Always meeting great people.
author: First P.

description: Cheap drinks, dark bar, efficient bartenders with the perfect side of attitude.
author: Mel H.

description: Great place to come hang out and have a drink. The owner gives back to the community ex. The resent event held to help raise money for the SFSPCA. Way to go!!!!
author: Rolo A.

description: The bartenders are over the top amazing! Great conversation, delicious bargain beverages and shuffle board. In addition they are dog friendly with dog treats behind the bar!!! Remember though... Cash only. A must visit bar in Mission!
author: Michelle F.

description:
This place looks kinda sketchy from the outside but when I walked in it posed different. With a shuffle board and a pac man machine I was set. The drinks were strong, the staff was friendly and great. We decided to come back the next night.

I will be coming back here for sure.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Ok this place is pretty awesome. A 2 block walk from Bart, a pretty decent bar. The bar tender is pretty cool and drinks are priced right. There is a rather large shuffle board table setup along one wall of the bar. While I am not a shuffle board player, I am a pinball player and yes Doc's Clock has pinball. I believe it is an Indiana Jones Tournament variety to be exact. Man I was so happy to see that. I didn't get to play it though because sadly there was a line.

But what I found in here that I haven't ever had at another bar before ... Hot Drinks :) Like a Hot Toddy, which is basically hot tea with whiskey and lemon.
