did i really stay here til 1:30am last night? this bar is your run-of-the-mill mission district bar. so many freaking hipsters. drinks are cheap, but it's cash only. they have shuffleboard, pinball, and an old school jukeboard to give it some character. it can get a bit crowded. really, it was just OK. there are better bars in the mission!

personally, i was more interested in going next door to the blue macaw but we didn't want to pay for cover...damn. next time.
author: Jen C.

description: Definitely a dive bar.  The sink in the men's bathroom was filled to the brim . . . with vomit.  All in all, pretty hip.
author: Khurram N.

description:
a bar so long, that stretches across the room
and it beckons, offering multiple second chances
for you to stop by, rest an arm atop the counter
and order glasses after glasses of $5 whiskey
author: Andrew P.

description: meanest doorstaff ever. gosh, bitch, sorry i don't live up to your cool-factor, but you don't have to lie -- bitch said my ID wasn't valid because it wasn't from California. NICE.
author: Amy K.

description: Again, automatic 4-stars for shuffleboard. Pretty damn good besides.
author: patrick g.

description:
This place is NOT SAFE.  A bartender here, "Antonio," tried to pick a fight with a friend of mine here, walked outside and repeatedly shouted at my friend to goad him into coming out to fight him.  The bouncer did nothing about it.  The owner of the bar, a dimunitive woman, told the bartender to take a "time out," which she explained was her solution to the problem because she couldn't tell who started the confrontation.

So to be clear: Her employee was shouting at a customer to come outside so he could BEAT HIM UP.  And both she and the bouncer refused to act.  The bartender is still working there.

This place is really dangerous.  Do NOT COME HERE, especially if you are a girl.
author: Donovan X.

description: Maybe it was the tequila, but I had hella fun at this little mission bar a couple of weekends ago.  Next time I'm wearing a white tee shirt cause this place has that feel -like- there- could- be- a- random- wet- t- shirt- contest- but-in-a -hot- way- not- a- spring- break- way kinda feel.  Ya know?
author: Claire C.

description: I love this place!  Why have I never been here before?  Maybe it's something about the pastel neon sign outside that is somewhat offputting...but HEY it keeps the bridge/tunnel peeps at Medjool out and the hip hipsters at bay.  That alone gets my 5 stars.  I can't wait to go back and play some shuffleboard.
author: Tabatha Y.

description: They have Connect Four. I met and had a conversation with Frank Chu there tonight. For those two reasons combined......5 stars.
author: Abby W.

description: i like that you can play board games but there's no gamekeeper and people kind of leave the boards and pieces in whatever box they want. the bar was pretty empty during happy hour, but started to fill up as the night went on. warming up a friday night with connect four and $3 dollar well drinks is always a fun time though. i recommend at least stopping in for a cheap drink!
author: Kimberly S.

description: This bar is designed to fit in a rail train - way too narrow and long.  and there aren't even windows on the side.  Also, weird kind of elvis/50s scene?!
author: Kurosh H.

description: You can learn a lot about a band based on how they handle folks occasionally needing to get in and out of the bathroom behind the stage.  Glass of whiskey + bittersweet country tunes = very good times.
author: L W.

description: I could literally sit for hours watching people play shuffleboard. I was mesmerized. Unfortunately during that time I was attacked by a mosquito and got four bites all up my arm. Gross! I know this may not technically be the bar's fault but it has tainted my memory of it irrevocably.
author: Cathy T.

description: Many get excited over the shuffleboard, but I'm all about the Connect Four! They have Othello, too, but that just doesn't feel like a bar game to me.
author: David K.

description:
it was fun playing shuffle board here.  never played that before
i guess there's also other games you could play..
came here before going to watch a band play at 12 galaxies a while back
author: charlotte s.

description:
this bar is ok. i don't find myself here unless I'm in the neighbourhood (seeing a show at 12 galaxies or the make-out room). but whenever i do come here, i always have a pleasant experience. i was just here last night - before i saw a show at make-out room. it must have been a while since i've been here because i don't remember them having a jukebox or a frogger arcade game before. the jukebox is pretty decent ... pretty well stocked with indie rock (with the odd misfits, sex pistols, and buzzcocks cd thrown in there). i won't be going out of my way to come here ever, but i will drop by here for at least one drink when / if i'm in this area and i'm thirsty. 

p.s. supposedly their happy hour goes until 9pm and pbrs are only $1. too bad i hate that piss water.
author: James J.

description: Doc's Clock is the best place to go if you want to "get to know" someone. Doesn't have to be biblically a friend will do but bring some extras to tag along because the shuffleboard is funner that way. Don't expect a huge crowd because it's usually empty but it makes for a better chance at the table.
author: cindy n.

description: Shuffle board, cheap drinks, the mission!  What more could want from your favorite dive bar.  OK well maybe a photo booth
author: Eric M.

description:
decent hangout and would go back again but didn't really have too much of a sway either way.
they have shuffleboard in the back that sounds like it would be fun but you have to wait your turn to play.
wasn't too crowded (thursday night) but still filled with a good amount of people.
drink selection pretty good and service was decent.
wouldn't make it a "must-go" on your list of bars to frequent but it's okay if you're looking for somewhere to drink and you're standing right outside.
author: Lily B.

description: Divey bar with stiff drinks what more can you ask for?
author: Manny C.

description: You can't beat a bar with a shuffleboard table, although you've got to show up hell of early to use it. The $1 Pabst pints during happy hour can't be beat.
author: Tim T.

description: As far as bars go this place is pretty cool.  They have a shuffle board table, board games (pictionary, trivial pursuit, sorry, scrabble), two arcade games (only one was working though), plenty of seating (4 booths, 5 mini tables and bar seating) and a juke box.  Their decorations include old school mystery novel advertisements and my Washington Apple was delicious.
author: Hillary J.

description: stopped in for a quick drink on a friday night. great people, great bartenders, great games, and great bacon wrapped hotdogs sold outside from shady vans with children playing inside of them.
author: Ameer N.

description: My favorite mission dive bar. Period.
author: Joel M.

description:
A good bar.
Nothing too special though.

Shuffle board and Connect 4 are awesome.
author: Henry C.

description: You Know this has got to be one of my favorite Mission bars. For some strange reason I always end up here in the middle of the night. I know it's not for the board games. But one things for sure and that's the draught PBR.  Some weekends it's pretty packed but you'll probably end up catching up with some people that you haven't seen in a while. Don't forget to bring some cash, as this place doesn't take credit cards. Trailer Park punch bitches.
author: Jacob S.

description:
any bar that has a happy hour lasting until 9pm is worthy of five stars.  
wednesday night, it was dedd.  and i mean that in a good way.  they have chimay on tap, and at a decent price, happy hour or no.  also, for those who want to while away the hours on a random weeknight (or weekday, for that matter) there are board games for everyone.  i'm not a risk girl, but i might go back for some trivial pursuit.
author: Aimee B.

description: Best bar in the best drinkin' part of San Francisco.  Don't miss the jukebox, pinball and shuffleboard!
author: Tod G.

description: This was the last stop of our Saturday night. I like this place because it's laid back, long extended bar, with a back room of tables and booths. People were playing shuffleboard and other table games. Some people even brought their dogs.
author: Nancy F.

description: I couldn't have had a better more classic bar experience. I was spending the evening solo because Jenn had to work. I had a couple of hours to kill before heading downtown to catch my buddy's band. She recommended I stop in here because of the vibe and the jukebox. She couldn't have been more right. The jukebox was magnificent. Tons of classic punk, soul, rock-n-roll. The vibe was purely "old-school". Just a long dim room with a very long bar, a pool table, a shuffleboard table and a couple booths in the back. And that killer jukebox. They had Lagunitas Pilsner on tap, $2 PBR's and all around cheap drinks. But what made my evening there, besides the music, was Lisa the bartender. I have rarely encountered a friendlier, kinder, or more cool, barkeep. She was curious about me, having never seen me there before and wanted to chat with me about myself and what I was doing in town etc. even though she got busy. She seemed to make time for all the solo drinkers. But she was completely genuine with every single person. She also insisted I help her "test" some whiskey and bought me a shot. I had a few more pints and was on my way but not before she could say goodbye and wish me a great trip. I did have a great trip and stopping by Doc's that night was one of the best time's I had this time around in SF. Cheers Lisa!
author: Frank M.

description: It's a bar. What more can be said? The music is good, not too loud, if there is music. Lighting is good - you can actually see who you're talking to without squinting. It's cool. Not much to say. I'd recommend it for a chill night with friends.
author: Melissa A.

description: Doc's clock is a great place to go to get your mid week drinking going.  Find me there on Tuesday evenings drinking $1 PBR and a bourbon.  Nice atmosphere.  Good crowd.
author: oliver w.

description: It seems like this place doesn't get a lot of love, but it should.  They have a great selection of draft beers and the long bar that leads into the back room is a nice touch.  The jukebox also boasts a rather good selection of rock n' roll (yes, rock'n'roll, not stink 182 or some other radio bullshit).  My one con comes from when I was standing at the bar empty handed for about 5 minutes, waiting patiently, noticed one of the bartenders look over at me, keep cleaning, look over again in about another minute, then after about another two minutes finally come and ask if I needed something.  "Well unless you serve food, then what am I here for, bitch?" was my answer in my head but I calmly ordered a beer.  Beyond this one exchange the bartenders could use a little lesson in "What can I get you?" with a smile instead of "I rule this fucking bar, do you need a drink?" with a smug look.
author: Steven R.

description:
i'm here every sunday. i don't know why this is the spot we've chosen but it is. we could have a good time drinking forties out of paper bags in the alley as long as we were together- but doc's has turned out to be a lovely alternative. 
whether we're playing drinking shuffle board, or talking shit over a heated game of connect four- this has proved to be a good spot. 

oh- we invented a lovely drink named after the occasion we enjoyed it on: a purim (pronounced: poor-um)  it's sapphire on the rocks with a splash of tonic, tomolive brine and tomolives. delicious!
author: gertie s.

description: I went here as part of a friend's birthday pub-crawl. I wasn't knocked out by it, but it was mellow. Not a great beer selection, but tolerable.
author: Melissa L.

description: I'm definitely not a hipster and definitely not a fan of the Mission's hipster dive-bar scene, but this place is somehow awesome. It avoids the pretension of other places and has a really cool vibe. There was even this really cool dog roaming around. Drinks were also really reasonably priced; my friends and I were headed off to Ruby Skye, but I secretly wanted to stay at Doc's Clock.
author: Eston B.

description: This place would probably annoy the hell out of me on some Friday or Saturday night when the bar is full and there's no way you're getting on shuffleboard, but for a cozy place to catch up with some old friends like I needed last night, it hits the spot. Cheap beer ($3!) and an easygoing atmosphere, we could actually all hear each other and people were pleasant. That sort of thing is my bag, baby.
author: Ian M.

description:
I saw the Pixies documentary "loudQUIETloud" here just a few nights ago. I didn't realize we were going to be watching a movie at a bar, so I didn't have my ID with me. This is one of the few bars in San Francisco that didn't card me when I ordered a drink (I look like I'm 15). Also, happy hour was going on till 9, so we still got cheap drinks. It's kind of a weird space to see a movie (a little cramped, very few seats) but it was cool nonetheless. 

I was wondering what the thing pushed off to the side was, now I know it's a shuffleboard table. They also have the Frogger arcade game, but it looked dead.
author: a a.

description: Dimly lit dirty bar that smells slightly of bleach - but definitely a nice bar hop down the strip. Good local ambiance, but not the best Manhattan. Great place to stop in for a drink, but not nice enough to stay for two. Manhattan rating: Very sweet. Tasted slightly like nyquil.
author: Gwenyth K.

description: Good bar for a date.  Usually dead, so not the best pick up bar.
author: Matt N.

description: In all my visits here (my friends really need to learn to embrace variety), I have never played shuffle board. After 6 games and no wins, I am convincing myself that I need to practice. Looking forward to a lot more shuffle board (its going to make variety hard to get).
author: Alicia J.

description: I like this bar that is dark. I like the keg of guinness that sits directly below the tap. I like that local musicians will hang  out in the back and play. I like it when I'm with a few friends and the rest of the world is somewhere else. I like the heavy pours. I think the new owner is super nice and cute, too. I like it when people give bad reviews to my favorite bars. I hope that the word doesn't get out that this bar is really really cool.
author: Jon F.

description: I like this place,but I left my umbrella here a few years ago. Did anyone happen to locate a Burberry-knockoff plaid full-sized umbrella hanging off the middle of the bar?
author: Rene D.

description: Coolest thing about this place is the shuffleboard. Usually fairly dead or empty for some reason, but I kinda like that. You don't want to many people around you as you're drinking and playing shuffle board.
author: Eric O.

description: Laaaid Back. All I ever wanted in a bar. Fun, no BS people. Cheap Cheap drinks.
author: Sita B.

description: Low-key bar with good drinks.  I wish I remembered more about the bar itself but I was too busy chatting with the people I came with.  Overall, it must have been pretty good if we left at closing.
author: Naomi N.

description: Stiff pour, good juke box, cute bartenders.
author: Brandy S.

description: My favorite bloody marys ever. They put practically an entire salad in them. Olives, green beans, celery, sometimes the asparagus I think...and they will make them nice and spicy hot for ya...yum...
author: Kate S.

description: This bar has somehow managed to keep the same chill vibe through tons of changes in the Mission over the years.  Rarely too crowded even on weekends, great drinks, good prices, laid-back crowd, just a great place to chill out and have a few drinks.  And shuffleboard!
author: Deva H.

description: Very much enjoyed the shuffle board in the back.  The drinks are well priced.  This is a cash only bar and the ages ranged up to the mid 30s the Friday night we were there, though everyone looked like babies.  Between, Dominoes, Scrabble, and other various game options we were entertained.  The crowd is friendly and classic mission district.  There were a lot of locals hanging out that evening.  I have not tried the bathroom's at this point.
author: Diana L.

description: A pretty good bar to start out the night. Good happy hour specials. Games in the back. I've met a lot of people here to spend the rest of the night with. No, not like that! Just bar-hopping and "clubbing" and such.
author: Linda M.

description: I have only been here during the week and always have a fabulous time. In general Tuesdays and Wednesdays are not crowded - just scattered groups or couples having fun with their friends. I particularly like Doc's Clock because I can hear my companions and we can settle into a comfy booth to talk or get competitive with board games (connect four!) or shuffleboard.
author: Abigail R.

description: You can read b/c it remains fairly light inside while partaking in $2 fernet shots on Monday.  Always less crowded than surrounding bars which can be good or bad depending on the day and your mood.
author: Paul K.

description: Who gives a crap about the bar. You can get drunk anywhere although I suppose the price will vary. Anyhow, I advise anybody who hasn't been here to go and try the shuffleboard. If you're like me and couldn't stop watching curling at the Winter Olympics, you're going to be batty for this game. The rules are a touch complex, but you can get the hang of it quick enough. It's like that old cheeseball saying, "Minutes to learn, a lifetime to master." Was that Rubik's Cube?
author: aaron f.

description: The first thing you notice is The Sign. It's all old-timey looking and cool. The inside of the bar is long and skinny (reminds me of someone I know :-)) but a little bit kind of dingy. Not that it has to be all foo foo or anything, it's just a neighborhood bar. But the thing I really loved about it is they sponsor screenings of new films in the back part of the room. That's why I went in the first place, to see Kurt Weitzmann's new film "Last Call." There was also another documentary being screened and although there were technical difficulties, the staff was "on it." I really appreciate a place that will support local artists. I have to admit that I had nothing to drink at all because I was driving, but they did seem to have a full selection of the usual suspects. Next time I go I'll order a drink or two to support this establishment that supports the arts!
author: Beth S.

description: love this place. completely unpretentious. shuffleboard. friendly bartenders who don't appreciate hipster attitudes. love love love.
author: amy W.

description: Just a happy little place to hang out and drink with some friends.  It's got a great central Mission location, making it a perfect launching point/crash site for an evening.  Good times.
author: Jesse H.

description: Typical SF Bar.  The shuffle board table can be a lot of fun, but only if there is not a band and it is not crowded...which is not often.
author: Pele N.

description: The shuffleboard table is completely fucked up.  The people who played after us looked like total pros on it though.  One of those tables with long slippery paths and big sticky patches, beautiful once you learn how to work it.
author: Kasey K.

description: since Im a fan of bar activities, the shuffleboard makes this bar top my list of good bars to do activities at. Long and skinny and sometimes loud, I generally avoid it on the weekends but do enjoy it week nights!
author: Inome C.

description: Great bar to relax in and have a couple of beverages.. The new owner has done a great job of keeping this place one of my favorite bars to go to!
author: Rafi M.

description: Dont you at times just wanna go out to the city and just get blastered drinking without having to worry about a guestlist or even a dresscode. You might just find yourself frequenting this bar more than just once. The crowd is cool, and the drinks strong, and to make things better the bartenders there always seem to have a few of their very own cocktail recipes.
author: Raj K.

description: Lagunitas IPA on tap and $2 Olympia = good enough for me.
author: neil o.

description:
lesser known points from from the official tournament table shuffleboard rules:

* Short foul line rule is in effect. 

* If there is no score in a frame, the hammer switches. 

* No double release shots shall be permitted. 

* A shot of Fernet is required before playing game point
(ok, I made this one up)

* If the object weight has wax on the side which may result in a "soft" or "mush" hit, you may have an official wipe it off and re-spot it
author: Dave K.

description: You wanna play shuffle board and have a group of friend at a dive bar? go to doc's clock. It s great little spot that you can pretty much own if you go with a group.
author: Isaac N.

description: Greatest attraction is one of the very few shuffleboard tables in the city (although you may want to get there early - it gets popular later in the evening). Drinks are cheap and strong. Atmosphere is everything you'd want from a dive bar - relaxed, slightly grungy, and inviting of deep inebriation.
author: Alexandra F.

description: Whenever I pay this dive bar a visit, I'm only going for the happy hour.  It's the quick stop to start your night not end it.  Everyone here's unpretentious and that's the way I like it.  And it's the only place I know with a shuffleboard.  How cool is that?
author: Eileen Q.

description: I really like this place. Weeknights, especially for happy hours (until 8PM, I think?) are awesome because it's quiet and the bartenders are friendly. Great bar, lots of seating, friendly vibe.
author: Liboo K.

description:
one of the few bars n the mission where you don't have to worry about looking cool enough to be there. no one there was trying too hard, i loved the easy going vibe!

also, $4 drinks
bitchin juke-box (four plays for a dollar! on a real juke-box, not one of those lame internet ones)
board games galore!
10 o'clock on a saturday night and i could actually sit down and have a conversation without yelling.

loved it!!
author: emily w.

description: Ideally, Doc's Clock promotes to be the kind of place that has no prententions. Recently they have proven themselves otherwise.  The people that go to the bar are great, the space comfortable, and the "games" amusing, but the recent staff has made me think twice of going again. If you were civil and nice to the bartenders and bouncers, they treated you like meatwads.  You lose.  If you were a prick, and acted raw, they treated you like dirtballs.  You lose.  It was a lose, lose situation, and it is sad, because it always used to be a win x 2.
author: Erin L.

description: supposedly a lesbian bar but both times i've been here i've seen drunk straight couples dry humping on tables in the back.  i think maybe there were a couple of lesbians sitting at the bar.  who knows, i am no lesbian detective.  not that i don't love lesbians, i do.  although i am not one.  anyway, this place has shuffleboard and it's the only place i know of in sf with shuffleboard.  also, the bartender was really nice.  but maybe she was hitting on me?!  just kidding!!!
author: Laura B.

description: wow i live in the mission and cant believe i just went to this place. great vibe with smiley happy people. the shuffleboard table was a cool idea. what better way for a bunch of drunks to spend their time? and i had a friend who randomly got a bingo game going in the back as well...hilarious.
author: Susan M.

description: not sure why i've never been here before tonight. huge bar, good drinks, a shitload of boardgames, shuffleboard (shuttlepuck? what the hell is it called?), and amazing color combinations.. doc's is definitely on my list for future visits.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: If you stand near the entrance at the start of what is a ridiculously long bar, with hundreds (?) of back lit bottles of the sweetest elixir, and face said doorway, sooner or later you'll see the 14 Mission Muni bus glide by powered only by the cables and its indifference to "official schedules", filled with junkies, thugs, Mexican restaurant workers, and the homeless- it moves nearly silently continuing its all night quest to deliver person x to place y- but as it passes Doc's Clock, something downright ephemeral happens; the multi-hued light bulbs that illuminate the bar's signage reflect on the bus windows, completing a kind of you-are-here- feedback loop letting you know that even though the bathrooms are unsafe and small, and there's not enough stools to go around, you've now become to witness to your own placeness in the mission, and as the lights complete their return trip to your irises, while simultaneously wishing for a camera on a tripod, you thank (your own, private, small-g,)god that whatever walks in through that same open door would never, ever, walk in to Foreign Cinema (shudder), so that when the 14 has finally passed on its way to deepest darkest heart of Soma it's okay to just be somewhere simple, without din and hue of "out" - no you're just having a drink, on a weekend, in the Mission, why is that so hard, so revelatory?
author: Olu J.

description: How can you not love this bar? A great selection of booze at a reasonable price and shuffle board! . I always have a grand time whenever I walk under the great sign that adornes this Mission wonderland. I always feel like I'm in the 1940's in this bar which has both it's good ("Hey kid, beat it. You're messing up my business here, see") and bad ("that damm Truman!") aspects to it. This place is also a great place to meet some friends for drinks because it's right near the 24th st. BART and also is a great after show place for sips being close by to 12 Galaxies and Brunos. Speaking of 12 Galaxies, you know that cat who walks around town with that sign that says 12 Galaxies? He was in Doc's Clock the other night. It was a little more than surreal to see drunk women posing in typical drunk woman ways (the Charlies Angel pose. You know what I'm talking about. Whenever 3 or more drunk women get togther and pose for a picture, they always do the Charlie's Angels pose. You know what I'm saying!) while the 12 Galaxies guy kept talking about all 12 of his galaxies. Anyway, this bar is wonderful. Stop by...
author: Benji T.

description: better than I thought it was going to be.  but first thing: it's not a "dive bar."  dive bar = dirty, old, with a grizzled crowd of bar vets who you know have been coming there for 20 years.  doc's clock = fresh, airy, clean, and full of fresh, airy, clean people.  at a dive bar you watch your step, don't look at your glass too carefully, and feel like you can hide in a corner all night.  doc's clock - none of those things.  which, by the way, means that's it's a very nice place, decent place to get a drink, with lots of room and a nice staff.  But you shouldn't be in a "dive bar" state of mind when you walk in the door
author: James R.

description: I would agree with the gent who said the barkeep's a bit like mom. Since Arrow Bar closed in my lovely SOMA backyard I've had to make the trek out to Doc's in order to get a drink. It's the only place without an in-crowd desperately trying to ruin my 30 minutes of intoxicated peace. The folks at Doc's aren't trying to be cool, sexy, or even trying to not to be trying (this of course is less true on the weekends when it gets crowded with a different crowd). On a normal day, it's a place anyone can roll off the couch and go to for a beer field trip without having to worry about the things one finds in city bars- like men in suits dancing to techno. Instead you will find a row of stools and some nice, everyday ruffians sitting on them, drink in hand. Yes, it would seem such a bar does still exist in San Francisco. Word of advice: try the trailer park punch. You won't admit it, but you'll like it.
author: M J.

description: how could a bar that concocts trailer park punch specials be bad? there are a few things that i miss about living in SF and doc's clock is one of 'em. shuffle board, cheap beer, BART station right nearby for the east bay folk...i think it's perfect. multiple thumbs up. more than i actually have...
author: Loarah P.

description: if you like to drink in a hospital ward or locker room, then this is the place for you.
author: chreesh b.

description: you always need a good neighborhood "go-to" bar on your list of places to enjoy some down time. how cab you beat still being able to get PBR on tap!?!?
author: c k.

description: i would say who knew - but obviously the yelpers did. this is a great, chill bar that i somehow missed up until a month or so ago. it's the kindof place where wednesday feels like saturday and midnight feels like 9 pm.
author: julia r.

description: i can't think of anything really good or bad to say about this place. my gin and tonic was ok. maybe it would have been better if doc was bartending. maybe it was the giant neon sign that drew me in. come for the sign, stay for the drinks. yes, that's it...
author: Oleya P.

description: i never leave here even remotely sober.   seriously, there is crack in the drinks or something.  i don't care if you leave after 5 min, you're drunk.  also home to the greatest bouncer ever.
author: Bernard W.

description: They've got shuffleboard.  Which I'm sort of good at.  Because it doesn't take skill and isn't dangerous, like other bar games (pool, darts, spitting game) are.  Plus, last time I was there, someone left part of a (chocolate? vanilla?) birthday cake on a table in back, and I'm pretty sure that I had a piece.
author: Hannah J.

description: This place is decent.  good beer and if you're there mon-wed, you can get a good deal on one of their specials.  There is lots of space, booths, barstools, tables, pool and mangy dogs.
author: pauline e.

description: good strong pour, doesn't really get packed since i've been there, easy location and great selection of poison for debauchery!  i'll be back.
author: regina k.

description: go here and play shuffleboard all hammered, its rad. a buddy of mine puked in a hat here. there's cheap beers and sometimes half way decent mix drinks for cheap. the weird part of about this place is that when you walk in it smells like you walked in to a bathroom and when you're right next to the bathroom it doesn't smell.
author: Mike L.

description: our attempts to play shuffleboard were stymied.  cash only bar. lots of hipsters. bitchy bartender.  par for the course in the mission.  still, SHUFFLEBOARD.
author: K H.

description: two dollar oly's is all that needs to be said.  this is perfect for a cheep insecitive prick such as my self.  you get wasted on twenty dollars and only have a minor head ache.  the girls behind the bar are great, they give hell to anyone who is drinking a lemon drop, especially all the douchey duds that wander on over from the more expensive, but offering the same prodcut bars across the street.  not to mention they have the bad ass shuffle board in back, and jameson for dirt cheep as well.  anyone who does not respect this dive bar, and one of the last true dive bars in the city is a fool.  get over your self if some one was mean to you, if you had to deal with all the assholes that came into a place like that you would be less then cordial as well.-uncle al
author: Uncle AL J.

description: i love shuffle board and i think this is the only one left in the city. usually find a bag of dope or some money on the ground, if your into that kinda thing.
author: Jeff B.
